Subject: Method to run single test, different data

From: autophile@...

Hi all,

I'd like to run 100 tests which do exactly the same thing but use
different data/result sets. I couldn't find anything in JUnit that
would allow me to do this so that TestRunner would display all 100
tests using the data set name rather than the test name (since there's
really only one test method).

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know!

In the meantime, here's what I did as a work-around:

1. In the TestCase, have the constructor take in a single String,
which is the name of the data set.

2. In the constructor, call super(yourSingleTestMethodName), and store
away the data set name somewhere.

3. Override both getName() and toString() to return the data set name.
We can do this because the code in TestCase actually accesses the
private test name variable (containing yourSingleTestMethodName) and
not getName(), name(), or toString().

4. In your suite() method, iterate over all the data sets, adding the
test cases:

Iterator i = dataSetNames.iterator();

while (i.hasNext())
  suite.addTest( new MyTestCase( (String)i.next() );


And now the TestRunner will display the data set name as the name of
the test, yet it will run yourSingleTestMethodName as the actual test.

Clearly this is a kludge relying on the internals of the TestCase
code. Hopefully the next release of JUnit will include a method to run
a single test with different data sets while displaying the name of
the data set.
subject: Method to run single test, different data
